dish_description: The dish is a simple yet classic roasted chicken, prepared with butter, salt, and pepper, and cooked in a specific manner to ensure even browning and juiciness. The chicken is trussed for better shape retention during cooking, and it is roasted on different sides before being basted and served with a natural juice gravy and watercress.

cooking_steps.description: Prepare the chicken by removing the wishbone for easier carving later. Cut on each side of the wishbone, push it forward, and then pull it out.

Truss the chicken with butcher twine to hold its shape during cooking. Go underneath the chicken with the twine, cross above, go under the drumsticks, close it, turn the chicken around, and secure the twine behind the wings.
Season the chicken with a tablespoon of butter, salt, and pepper, ensuring to season inside the cavity as well as all around the exterior.
Start roasting the chicken on one side in a preheated oven at 425 degrees Fahrenheit for 20 minutes, then turn to the other side and roast for another 20 minutes.
After roasting on both sides, turn the chicken breast-side up and baste it every 3-5 minutes, continuing to roast for a final 20 minutes, completing a total cooking time of 1 hour.
Once the chicken is cooked, let it rest for a few minutes before carving. Do not cover it with foil to keep the skin crispy.
Prepare the natural juice gravy by deglazing the pan with chicken stock, removing excess fat, and thickening the sauce with potato starch to the desired consistency.
Carve the chicken by first removing the twine, then separating the legs and breasts from the carcass. Present the chicken with watercress and pour the natural juice gravy over the carved pieces.
